intro: Hieracium carolinianum f. glabrescens, commonly known as the Carolina hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems that are often glabrous in this form, giving it a smooth appearance. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a serrated margin. The flowers are yellow and appear in late spring to early summer, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
